metadata.title: CVE-2015-8970 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
crypto/algif_skcipher.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4.2 does not verifythat a setkey operation has been performed on an AF_ALG socket before anaccept system call is processed, which allows local users to cause a denialof service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) via a craftedapplication that does not supply a key, related to the lrw_crypt functionin crypto/lrw.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-7-generic - 4.4.0-7.22
linux-image-4.4.0-7-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-7.22
linux-image-4.4.0-7-lowlatency - 4.4.0-7.22
linux-image-4.4.0-7-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-7.22

linux-image-4.4.0-7-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-7.22
linux-image-4.4.0-7-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-7.22
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-7-generic - 4.4.0-7.22
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-7.22').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
